title: I want to learn English grammar from the start, literally from the beginning. What book should I choose? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s no doubt that English grammar forms the basis for your knowledge of this foreign language. To my mind, one should practice English grammar from the very beginning of the language learning process. One of the most useful ways of practicing it is using specific books. I recommend these ones: 1.	Round-Up (Pearson & Longman) This book is usually highly recommended by many teachers. It has 7 levels (from “Starter” to level 6). So, you have an opportunity to improve your English grammar skills step by step. I can’t tell you what a useful book it is. Why? a lot of pictures which help you understand some complicated grammar issues;the colorful design of pages which makes you stay focused on grammar even if you don’t like it;a good deal of humor: there are lots of funny jokes in the dialogues which are aimed to make your learning experience entertaining;a mix of different types of tasks: dialogues and tests, completing, rephrasing and rewriting the sentences, filling in the gaps and underlining the correct word;nice grammar explanations;idioms and phrasal verbs.2.	Oxford Practice Grammar This book is actually more serious than the previous one. Nevertheless, I like its structure. Having worked with this book, I can definitely say that the exercises are drafted in such a way as to make you practice the rules thoroughly. So, the effectiveness of your English grammar studying process depends on your efforts. Use the books I mentioned above and do your utmost!

1. Essential Grammar in Use with Answers: A Self-Study Reference and Practice Book for Elementary Learners of English (By Raymond Murphy)  Clarity and ease of use have made this book one of the world’s best seller grammar books for English learners. Intended for Elementary-level learners (A1), the book covers all the grammar areas that you will need at this level, with clear examples, easy-to-follow exercises and answer key. 2. Advanced Grammar in Use with Answers: A Self-Study Reference and Practice Book for Advanced Learners of English (By Martin Hewings)  Illustrated in full colour and with a user-friendly layout, this popular grammar book contains 100 units of grammar reference and practice materials. It is ideal for learners gearing up for the Cambridge Advanced, Proficiency or IELTS Examination. Informed by the Cambridge International Corpus, the book is credited to the authentic and up-to-date language. 3. Basic English Grammar with Audio CD, with Answer Key (By Betty Schrampfer Azar, Stacy Hagen)  The book uses a grammar-based approach integrated with communicative methods to boost the development of all language skills. It engages students in meaningful communication about real actions and things, and their own lives in classroom context. The fourth edition comes with new features, including information in the grammar charts shedding light on differences between spoken and written English, easy-to-follow writing activities, innovative warm-up exercises introducing points to be taught and followed by the grammar charts, newly created exercises for more incremental grammar practice, and structure-based listening exercises for students’ relaxed, reduced speech. 4. Practice Makes Perfect Advanced English Grammar for ESL Learners: Advanced ESL Grammar (By Mark Lester)  Authored by Mark Lester, an ESL grammar expert and the founder of the highly respected ESP department at the University of Hawaii, the book covers most popular college classroom grammar, including noun plurals, possessive nouns, personal pronouns, adjectives, articles and quantifiers, verb forms and tenses, causative verbs, the passive, adjective clauses, noun clauses, etc. Over 700 exercises will give you highly effective practices. 5. English Grammar in Use: A Self-study Reference and Practice Book for Intermediate Students of English - With Answers (By Raymond Murphy)  The fourth edition comes with fresh, attractive new design, clear layout and revised and updated examples while retaining the key features of clarity and accessibility that have made the book one of the most popular English grammar books among learners and teachers around the world.
